titleStmt.title: When the Seahorse Entered the Sea

availability.p: Note that the CC licence only applies to the XML file. Users should also cite the original source of the text.

sourceDesc.bibl: Marlett, Stephen A. (2022): Words from Another World. A Collection of Analyzed Seri Texts. Oaxaca: Instituto Lingüístico de Verano. Quot. pp. 128-139.

projectDesc.p: Text digitized and encoded for use in the Forager Folklore Database. The FFDB offers a basis for a systematic study of narrative universals, the evolutionary origin of storytelling, and (comparative) folklore studies.

samplingDecl.p: The narrative was selected for being a genuine piece of oral literature recorded directly, or mediated by an interpreter, from a narrator who either lived or grew up as a member of a culture whose subsistence at the time of recording was, or until recently had been, depending primarily on hunting, gathering, and/or fishing. Care was taken to ensure the quality of the recording and the relative absence of external cultural influences.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the p prefix are pointers to person elements in the personography.xml file.
URIs using the q prefix are Wikidata Q identifiers and refer to the respective entries on Wikidata.
Private URIs using the g prefix are pointers to the respective lemmas in the FFDB collection of glossaries.

editorialDecl.p: Footnotes are generally retained, but no effort has been made to link the narratives mentioned in comparative notes with corresponding records within the FFDB.
Page numbers have been retained, but page beginnings, pb, occurring within a word have been moved either before or after the word (or nominal phrase) on a case to case basis, without general rule.

normalization.p: Omissions as well as supplementations by the original editor are set in brackets. In all other cases, parentheses in the original are retained.
Latin passages in the original (usually to mask language and themes deemed indecent) are rendered in English.

hyphenation.p: End-of-line hyphenation has been removed. All other hyphenation has been retained.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained. No effort was made to mark up passages in quotation marks as, for example, q, quote, said, cit, or soCalled.

body.p: The seahorse was there [as a person, on the Earth], along with teddybear cholla cactus, the cholla cactus skeleton, the pencil cholla, the cardon cactus, and the saguaro cactus. The seahorse was a person and was running in the countryside while the others were shooting arrows at him. He was responding in kind by throwing rocks. He was coming close to Tecomate, near the place [now] called 'Where Seahorse Evaded'. He was taking evasive action and moving around, and for that reason the stones there look like they've been piled up. He kept running, and then went through the area around 'Big Crucillo Bush Bay' and arrived at the beach. As he was about to enter the sea, he removed his sandals, putting them behind him [under the cord holding up his waistcloth]. Then he fastened his braids - it's called the Seri man's braid yarn - it was here on his head. When a man was about to do something that required quick action, he would put his hair in braids, and fasten it so.The narrator was apparently indicating the top of his head at this point. The knot is still here [on the back of the head of the seahorse]. His sandals are here [referring to that place on the seahorse].

And so he went down into the sea, and that is why he became what is called the seahorse. The cholla cactus is full of holes, and the cardon cactus ribs are not close together, evidence of where they [rocks, etc.] hit and glanced off them, they say. That's how it is. The [seahorse] was a true ancestor. He was a person when he was doing this.

The cardon and the organ pipe cactus, all of them were Seris. The senita cactus was not a person. Well, he was a person, but he wasn't a real person. He had something to do with the Catastrophe. The senita cactus was the first of the plants to be created - before the cardon and before the saguaro. He was caught in the big wave that happened during the Catastrophe. He was with the ironwood tree at that time. That's how it was. It's widely known. And that's it.
